content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

### Block Count & Layers
The target structure consists of 6 building blocks arranged in 3 layers:
- Bottom layer: 1 red block with an arch/tunnel (base)
- Middle layer: 1 green rectangular block 
- Top layer: 1 yellow rectangular block with 3 orange triangular blocks on top

### Spatial Relationships
- Bottom layer: A red block with an arch/tunnel that forms the base
- Middle layer: A green rectangular block sits on top of the red base, positioned slightly toward the back
- Top layer: A horizontal yellow rectangular block rests on top of the green block
- Three orange triangular blocks sit on top of the yellow block, forming a roof-like structure

## Selection of Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on my analysis, I need the following blocks from the dictionary:

1. Block index 1: Red block with arch/tunnel (for base)
2. Block index 5: Green rectangular block (horizontal orientation)
3. Block index 8: Yellow rectangular block (horizontal orientation)
4. Block index 13: Orange triangular block (left side of roof)
5. Block index 14: Orange triangular block (middle of roof)
6. Block index 16: Orange triangular block (right side of roof)

## Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 1
   Step2: Move block with index 5
   Step3: Move block with index 8
   Step4: Move block with index 13
   Step5: Move block with index 14
   Step6: Move block with index 16
}
```

This assembly starts with the base, builds upward with the green and yellow blocks, and finishes with the triangular orange roof pieces from left to right.
